intro: Thryptomene homalocalyx, commonly known as the narrow-leaf thryptomene, is a small evergreen shrub native to eastern Australia. It belongs to the Myrtaceae family, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often aromatic and covered in fine hairs. It produces small, white or pale pink flowers that are clustered in dense, rounded inflorescences. Thryptomene homalocalyx is typically found in coastal and heathland environments, thriving in well-drained soils.
